discussion.p: mutex and recursive_mutex should have an is_locked() member function. is_locked allows a user to test a lock without acquiring it and can be used to implement a lightweight try_try_lock.

blockquote.p: to std::mutex and std::recursive_mutex. These functions return true if the current thread would not be able to obtain a mutex. These functions do not synchronize with anything (and, thus, can avoid a memory fence).

discussion.p: The Concurrency subgroup reviewed this issue and deemed it to be an extension to be handled after publishing C++0x.

rationale.p: The LWG does not wish to make a change at this time.
